p: Sesquiterpene lactones are among the most prevalent and biologically significant classes of secondary metabolites found across the plant kingdom, comprising over 5000 known compounds, being most common in families such as Cactaceae, Solanaceae, Araceae, and the Euphorbiaceae. 3-Butylphthalide ( Figure 13) is one of the most known lactones, and besides the “herbal” note associated with it, it is also mainly responsible for the “celery” aroma [ 153] .
